p: Both leaves and flowers of S. uliginosa Benth., studied by Giuliani et al. [ 27], were characterized by a high percentage of sesquiterpene hydrocarbons (90.1% and 92.18%, respectively). The most abundant compounds in flowers were biciclogermacrene (31.3%) and β-caryophyllene (25.6%). In the leaves, the above-cited compounds were also present (16.9% and 12.9%, respectively) even though γ-muurolene (31.4%) was the predominant constituent. Analyzing the S. scabra leaf aromatic profile, only β-caryophyllene was present in a high percentage (18.4%), while γ-muurolene was present in a reduced amount (0.1%); biciclogermacrene was completely absent.
